title.narrative: FORMAL EDUCATION FOR CHILDREN UTP (3-17)

description.narrative: By 2020, the education system has increased capacity to provide formal education opportunities for refugee children (3-17 years old) ., which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participationBy 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the education system has increased capacity to provide formal education opportunities for refugee children (3-17 years old).

description.narrative: Ensuring access to formal education opportunities for all children, particularly Syrian refugees Under Temporary Protection, remained UNICEF’s priority. UNICEF worked closely with the Ministry of National Education and other partners to ensure that children continued learning despite the COVID-19 pandemic which exacerbated challenges in accessing education for refugee children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2021
